JobFullDesc: Facebook’s Smart Decisions team in Probability is seeking a Postdoctoral Applied Researcher to help us research and develop solutions at the interface of deep learning and modern user-facing software systems. This is an opportunity to work on cutting-edge data-driven research topics and make important contributions to hundreds of use cases at Facebook.Individuals in this role must have a good understanding of Machine Learning (ML) fundamentals, a working knowledge of Deep Learning, and a track record of successful ML research. They will be expected to translate their research ideas into practice. Ideal candidates will be familiar with recent ML literature, have a keen interest in producing new science and building scalable systems that benefit Facebook users worldwide. Term length will be considered on a case-by-case basis.Subject areas of interest include: Robust ML models, Ensembling methods, AutoML, Transfer/Meta-Learning, Resource-efficient ML, Privacy-aware ML, Deep Learning for edge devices (model compression, quantization, distillation), Federated Learning, Reinforcement Learning, ML systems and platforms (design, evaluation and optimization), Fairness in ML, and Causal Inference.Collaborate on research to advance the state-of-the-art and apply novel ML techniques to real-world use casesUnderstand the needs of real-world applications, envision effective ML solutions, evaluate solution prototypes and move them to a production-ready codebaseCollaborate and increase productivity on existing projects as a contributing team memberInfluence the progress of relevant research communities by producing publicationsMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSCurrently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a doctoral degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or other relevant fieldsTrack record of publications at ML venues that demonstrate successful researchExperience of team work to solve analytical problems using quantitative approachesExperience communicating research to diverse audiences of peersConfident programming skills, familiarity with Python and fluency with some of the common ML frameworks (scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.)Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employmentFacebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together.
